metadata.Description: Energy diplomacy refers to the diplomatic efforts and negotiations related to energy resources, energy security, and energy cooperation between countries and international organizations.

entities: united nations framework convention on climate change

relations.Description: Energy diplomacy implements Energy Efficiency Policy to promote sustainable energy practices globally.
energy diplomacy funds Renewable Energy Projects to support the transition to clean and sustainable energy sources.
energy diplomacy focuses on improving energy access in underserved communities to promote sustainable development.
energy diplomacy plays a role in the International Energy Agency to promote international cooperation on energy issues.

relations.Object: united nations framework convention on climate change
relations.Description: energy diplomacy partners with the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change to address climate change through sustainable energy solutions.
energy diplomacy contributes to Sustainable Development Goal 7 by promoting affordable and clean energy for all.
energy diplomacy monitors the progress of energy transition to ensure the achievement of sustainable energy goals.
energy diplomacy targets energy efficiency measures to reduce energy consumption and promote sustainable energy practices.

relations-level-2.Subject: energy efficiency
relations-level-2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations-level-2.Subject: energy efficiency
relations-level-2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

relations-level-2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations-level-2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations-level-2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations-level-2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

relations-level-2.Subject: energy markets
relations-level-2.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations-level-2.Subject: energy markets
relations-level-2.Description: Energy markets employ renewable energy technologies to diversify the energy mix and reduce dependence on fossil fuels.

relations-level-2.Subject: just energy transition
relations-level-2.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

relations-level-2.Subject: just energy transition
relations-level-2.Description: The just energy transition supports energy equity by promoting equal access to clean and affordable energy.

relations-level-3.Subject: energy storage
relations-level-3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

relations-level-3.Subject: energy markets
relations-level-3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations-level-3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations-level-3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations-level-3.Subject: energy efficiency
relations-level-3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.
